instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 fan on max rpm
threads.message:
Cant find any liquid. There was some repair done around R6061 so there was some issue with SSD - tested another SSD and SSD is visible.

Fan runs at max RPM immediately after power on. 
Board + DC board only still same issue so dont think it is linked with trackpad and ASL.
Mac is not laggy. In iStat 'CPU System Agent Core'  show correct temp but after a few minutes 0 degree and then still shows correct temp.
Tried SMC reset/bypass and still the same.

Any idea?

threads.title: 820-00165 fan on max rpm
threads.message:
Missing ALS wil not affect fan speed.
Missing trackpad will increase fan speed after10-15s, not from moment zero.
Fan spins to max instantly if the board starts in SMC bypass; be sure SMC_ONOFF_L is steady high.

What is the exact PPBUS_G3H voltage (w/o battery)?
Start in diagnostic mode, to see if any error pops up.

Just in case, try clean ME BIOS.

threads.title: 820-00165 fan on max rpm
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H no battery 8.58V
PPBUS_G3Hbattery only 7.41V

Diagnostics:
There may be an issue with the fan: PPF003
There may be an issue with the camera NDC001 (camera works, but ASL is not working - can change keyboard backlight even in very bright room or torch - checked with another lid and still ASL issue)

threads.title: 820-00165 fan on max rpm
threads.message:
Test the machine disconnecting the webcam.
If works good, then isolate the SCL/SDA lines of ALS.

threads.title: 820-00165 fan on max rpm
threads.message:
With disconnected camera the same issue (instant fan on max rpms)
Diagnostics with the same error codes.

threads.title: 820-00165 fan on max rpm
threads.message: Check components and traces on Q6060 area.
